posts.title: Website Created
posts.content: I made this website to chronicle what I am learning about full stack web development. To make any of this happen, I first had to learn the basics of HTML and CSS. Then, I spent some time working on the simple javascript code for my Local Pastebin project. I made myself a little logo, and now I am brainstorming ideas for my next projects.

posts.title: Day of AWS Agony
posts.content: I spent longer than I'd like to admit learning how Node.js and Express work (very basics) so I can move this website over to AWS to prep for this blog to be turned into a MongoDB based blog. Currently it is all held in a JSON file. My next project is learning MongoDB usage and maybe even making a backend portal for me to make blog posts on.

posts.title: A Month?
posts.content: I have spent the better part of the last month relearning CSS and HTML. I started to do some work on JavaScript and quickly realized I needed to go back to the basics. I understand JavaScript OK, but full stack web dev is the goal, so that is what I am focusing on. Still working on that, but my CSS is moving along quickly. I'll work on styling the webpage and maybe focus on some more small projects.

posts.title: Big Life Changes
posts.content: I quit my job, tried something new and it unfortunately didn't work out. But... three months ago, I got my GED. And then on July 1st I started college at WGU and transferred in 35% of a BS. I'm aiming to finish as fast as possible. Oh! I also rewrote a discord bot I made (MovieNightBot) to use SQLite which was a fun practical learning exercise for an SQL class I was taking.

posts.title: Belt Tension Calculator
posts.content: I made a little belt tension calculator and put it up on Github pages. The reason its on github pages is I have made it for a friends business, and the page its hosted on is static elements. I ended up putting it in an iframe and loading it on the page. Heres the link, I am quite proud of it! https://lraithel15133.github.io/beltcalculator/ and http://lukeslab.info/en/belt-tension-guide
